bibl.title: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952

div1.p: Streit likes Hench's idea of having various medical schools and clinics place wreaths beneath the bust of Finlay. He has discussed this with Armstrong, Love, and Siler.

div1.head: Letter from Paul H. Streit to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1952
div1.opener:
WALTER REED
ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
WASHINGTON 12, D. C.
OFFICE OF THE COMMANDING GENERAL
21 November 1952
Philip S. Hench, M. D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I very much appreciated your letters and confidental
enclosures, which I received about one week ago, and your
letter of the 19th of November, which arrived yesterday
afternoon. You show great insight with reference to problems
in connection with the dedication in Havana honoring Dr.
Finlay. There is no man in America who is remotely as
familiar with the circumstances surrounding the work of
Dr. Walter Reed and his group as you are.

Your thought to have various medical schools and clinics
place a wreath beneath the bust of Dr. Finlay either during or
after the ceremony on December 3rd appears to me to be most
appropriate. I talked to Major General George E. Armstrong,
the Surgeon General about this, and he concurs with your plan
enthusiastically.

I also talked to General Albert Love, Retired, the
Secretary of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, and with
Colonel Siler. Colonel Siler has called a meeting of his
Executive Committee to take the necessary action in this
matter. Their fund is limited by law to certain definite ex-
penditures, but I hope that monies for this purpose can be
made available.

I have reservations at the Hotel Nacional for December
2nd. I am going down by National Air Lines and will arrive in
Havana at 3:45 p.m. on the 2nd of December. I expect to re-
turn to Washington on the morning of the 4th by air.

I will write you further with reference to the decisions
made by the Walter Reed Memorial Association as soon as I
hear definitely from Colonel Siler.

Philip S. Hench, M. D.
Page Two

Thank you for your continued interest in this very im-
portant matter.

closer.signed:
PAUL H STREIT
Maj Gen, MC
Commanding
